_header: Right goodly flower to whom I owe service
Subjects: lovers, addresses to beloved; love letters; lover’s plea
_description: A lover’s address to his mistress, possibly by the Duke of Suffolk — four stanzas rhyme royal

BodFair16.First Lines:
Ryght goodly flour to whom I owe seruyseWyth alle myn hert & to
                    none othir wyght…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…That lord a boue that syteth in his empireHe send yow ioy of
                    alle that ye desyre
BodFair16.Facsimiles:
Norton-Smith,  John. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Bodleian Library MS Fairfax 16.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
